# content

**Instance Property**

An array that provides data for the collection view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var content: [Any] { get set }
```

## Discussion

The content object manages the data in the collection view. Use this object to specify an array of items directly. This property is observable using key-value observing. The collection view also exposes a `content` binding value so that you can specify the array of items using an ArrayController object in Interface Builder.

To specify the data for your collection view, assign a value to this property or to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCollectionView/dataSource] property, but not both. If you specify a value for the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCollectionView/dataSource] property, the collection view ignores the value in this property.

## Configuring the Collection View

- **delegate**: The collection view’s delegate object.
- **NSCollectionViewDelegate**: A set of methods that you use to manage the behavior of a collection view.
- **backgroundView**: The background view placed behind all items and supplementary views.
- **backgroundColors**: An array containing the collection view’s background colors.
- **backgroundViewScrollsWithContent**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the collection view’s background view scrolls with the items and other content.
